name: smrnaseq-small-rna-profiling
title: sRNA-seq: microRNA & Small RNA Profiling
description: Comprehensive small RNA sequencing analysis for miRNA, piRNA, siRNA, and snoRNA quantification. Discovers novel miRNAs and analyzes post-transcriptional gene regulation. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2`
content:
sRNA-seq: Small RNA Profiling

nf-core/smrnaseq analyzes small RNA sequencing data (18-200 nt) to profile microRNAs, piRNAs, siRNAs, and other regulatory small RNAs. Essential for understanding post-transcriptional gene regulation, development, and disease.

What are Small RNAs?

Small RNAs (18-200 nucleotides) are regulatory molecules that control gene expression post-transcriptionally. They silence genes by binding complementary mRNAs or recruiting chromatin-modifying complexes.

Small RNA Classes

microRNAs (miRNAs) - 21-24 nt:

  • Most studied class
  • ~2,600 human miRNAs (miRBase)
  • Repress translation or induce mRNA decay
  • Regulate ~60% of protein-coding genes
  • Biogenesis: pri-miRNA → pre-miRNA (Drosha) → mature miRNA (Dicer)
  • Examples: let-7 (development), miR-21 (cancer oncomiR)

piRNAs (PIWI-interacting RNAs) - 24-32 nt:

  • Germline-specific (testis, ovary)
  • Silence transposable elements
  • Protect genome integrity during meiosis
  • 26-32M human piRNAs
  • Bind PIWI proteins (Argonaute family)

siRNAs (small interfering RNAs) - 21-23 nt:

  • Endogenous or exogenous (viral defense, RNAi experiments)
  • Perfect complementarity → mRNA cleavage
  • Antiviral immunity
  • Used therapeutically (Onpattro for hereditary ATTR amyloidosis)

snoRNAs (small nucleolar RNAs) - 60-300 nt:

  • rRNA modification (2'-O-methylation, pseudouridylation)
  • Ribosome biogenesis
  • Some processed into miRNA-like fragments (sdRNAs)

tRNA fragments (tRFs) - 14-30 nt:

  • Cleaved from mature tRNAs
  • Stress-induced (hypoxia, starvation)
  • Gene regulation, translation control

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Quality Control: FastQC assesses read quality
  2. Adapter Trimming: Remove 3' adapters (crucial for small RNAs)
  3. Collapse Reads: Merge identical sequences (reduce redundancy)
  4. Genome Alignment: Bowtie aligns to reference genome
  5. miRNA Quantification: Count reads mapping to known miRNAs (miRBase)
  6. Novel miRNA Discovery: miRDeep2 predicts new miRNAs
  7. Isomer Analysis: Detect isomiRs (length/sequence variants)
  8. QC Report: MultiQC aggregates all metrics

Scientific Applications

Cancer Biomarkers:

  • OncomiRs: miR-21, miR-155, miR-17-92 cluster (promote tumorigenesis)
  • Tumor Suppressors: let-7, miR-34a, miR-15a/16-1 (lost in cancer)
  • Circulating miRNAs: Liquid biopsy from blood (miR-141 in prostate cancer)
  • Drug Resistance: miR-21 in chemoresistance

Development & Differentiation:

  • let-7 family: Developmental timing (larval-to-adult transition in C. elegans)
  • miR-1, miR-133: Muscle development
  • miR-124, miR-9: Neuronal differentiation
  • miR-290 cluster: Embryonic stem cell identity (mouse)

Cardiovascular Disease:

  • miR-208, miR-499: Cardiac hypertrophy
  • miR-126: Angiogenesis, vascular integrity
  • miR-133: Biomarker for myocardial infarction

Neurodegeneration:

  • miR-29: Alzheimer's disease (regulates BACE1)
  • miR-133b: Parkinson's disease (Pitx3 regulation)
  • miR-206: ALS (neuromuscular junction)

miRNA Biogenesis

  1. Transcription: RNA Pol II produces pri-miRNA (~1kb)
  2. Nuclear Processing: Drosha/DGCR8 cleaves to pre-miRNA (~70nt hairpin)
  3. Export: Exportin-5 transports pre-miRNA to cytoplasm
  4. Cytoplasmic Processing: Dicer cleaves to miRNA duplex (~22nt)
  5. RISC Loading: Argonaute2 (AGO2) binds guide strand
  6. Target Recognition: Seed sequence (nt 2-8) binds 3' UTR of mRNA

miRNA Target Recognition

Seed Region (nucleotides 2-8):

  • Critical for target binding
  • Perfect complementarity to 3' UTR
  • Each miRNA targets ~200-1000 mRNAs
  • Each mRNA regulated by multiple miRNAs

Mechanisms of Action:

  • Translational repression: Block ribosome (most common)
  • mRNA deadenylation: Remove poly(A) tail → decay
  • mRNA cleavage: If perfect complementarity (rare in mammals)

IsomiRs (miRNA Isoforms)

Variants of canonical miRNA sequences:

  • 5' isomiRs: Different 5' end (shifts seed sequence!)
  • 3' isomiRs: Different 3' end (most common, ~80%)
  • Templated additions: Extra nucleotides from pri-miRNA
  • Non-templated additions: Uridylation, adenylation (affect stability)

IsomiRs can have different targets and functions than canonical miRNA

Sequencing Library Protocols

Illumina TruSeq:

  • Standard small RNA library prep
  • 3' and 5' adapter ligation
  • Size selection (18-40 nt insert)
  • Most widely used

NEBNext:

  • Less bias than TruSeq (improved ligases)
  • Better for low-input samples
  • Similar workflow

QIAseq miRNA:

  • UMI-based (unique molecular identifiers)
  • Removes PCR duplicates accurately
  • Quantitative

Sequencing Depth

GoalReads per SampleNotes
miRNA Profiling5-10M readsDetect highly/moderately expressed
Novel miRNA Discovery20-30M readsFind low-abundance miRNAs
isomiR Analysis10-20M readsDeep coverage for variants
Biomarker Studies5-10M readsConsistent depth across samples

Read Length Requirements

  • Sequencing length: 50-75 bp single-end (SE)
  • Insert size: 18-40 nt (small RNA)
  • Adapter content: ~30-50 nt adapters on both ends
  • Total read: Small RNA + adapters fill the read length

Quality Metrics

  • Size Distribution: Peak at 21-24 nt (miRNA-enriched)
  • Adapter Trimming: >90% reads have 3' adapter detected
  • Mapping Rate: 60-80% to genome (miRNA regions)
  • miRBase Mapping: 30-60% of reads (tissue-dependent)
  • Contamination: Check for rRNA, tRNA (should be <10%)

Differential Expression Analysis

Identify miRNAs with altered expression:

  • Disease vs Healthy: Biomarker discovery
  • Treatment vs Control: Drug response
  • Time Course: Developmental dynamics
  • Tissue Specificity: miR-122 (liver), miR-1 (muscle), miR-124 (brain)

Statistical tools: DESeq2, edgeR, limma-voom

Clinical Applications

Diagnostics:

  • Circulating miRNAs as liquid biopsy
  • Cancer subtyping (miRNA signatures)
  • Prognostic markers (survival prediction)

Therapeutics:

  • miRNA mimics: Restore lost tumor suppressor miRNAs
  • AntagomiRs: Inhibit oncogenic miRNAs (anti-miR-122 for HCV)
  • miravirsen: First miRNA therapeutic (Hepatitis C)

Example miRNAs & Functions

miRNAFunctionDysregulation
miR-21Anti-apoptotic, oncomiRUpregulated in most cancers
let-7Tumor suppressor, differentiationDownregulated in cancer
miR-155Immune regulation, oncomiRLymphoma, inflammation
miR-122Liver function, lipid metabolismHCV replication, liver disease
miR-34ap53-regulated, tumor suppressorLost in cancer

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with columns:

  • sample: Sample ID
  • fastq_1: Path to FASTQ file (single-end)

Key Outputs

  • miRNA Counts: Expression matrix (samples × miRNAs)
  • Novel miRNAs: Predicted by miRDeep2
  • IsomiRs: Sequence and length variants
  • Small RNA Classes: Breakdown (miRNA, rRNA, tRNA, snoRNA, etc.)
  • Size Distribution: Read length histogram
  • QC Reports: FastQC, MultiQC summaries

Perfect for: miRNA biomarkers • Gene regulation • Cancer profiling • Development • Post-transcriptional control • Liquid biopsy
